mods.abstract: FIFTY DOLLARS REWARD.--RAN away on 20th ult., the slave girl ELIZA, aged about 35 years, griffe color, about 5 1/2 feet high, speaks French and English, sullen countenance, has a good set of teeth, and a scar on one of her breasts, as of a burn. She is well acquainted in the city. The above reward will be paid for the arrest of said slave, and the delivery of same at the parish jail and for such information as will lead to the conviction of any one harboring her. MRS. M.R. PRITCHARD, Apply at 24 Carondelet street. d17 1m
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
